attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition concerns the recent announcement on TeacherNet regarding 'School Revenue Balances'.
In his statement to Parliament on the 25th June, Jim Knight proposed to consult stakeholders in the autumn term
"We will consult on the detailed implementation of this measure in the autumn, but local authorities and schools forums will take final decisions on how this funding will be reinvested locally." 
Instead the dept has pushed on at breakneck speed and is penalising schools who are reducing their balances in a prudent fashion by imposing the clawback on last years balance.
This measure will unfairly penalise small schools in particular, for most of whom an 8% upper balance limit is trivially small, not even one teachers annual salary.
The proposal is a blunt, crude, and indiscriminate instrument which penalises the prudent whilst potentially rewarding the spendthrift.
